intro: Robinsonia saxatilis, commonly known as the rock rose. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae, native to the Mediterranean region. This evergreen shrub is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters during the spring and summer months. The plant is well adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a hardy choice for coastal and arid environments.
